research_interest: Research Interests: Decentralized Computing, Information Security, Software Engineering
about_news: <0>New I have been an assistant professor at both the Information Media Center and Graduate School of Advanced Science and Engineering, Hiroshima University , since April 2024. I am open to academic and industrial collaborations. Please feel free to contact me if you have any interest.
about_general: I am passionate about constructing provably correct systems by discovering theories from practice and developing methodologies for practice. My primary focus centers around the security and privacy aspects of software engineering, particularly decentralized systems spanning protocol and application levels. Currently, I am constructing Transition-Oriented Programming, a new programming paradigm to facilitate developing provably correct systems.
about_bio:
<0>Bio Yepeng Ding is an assistant professor at both the Information Media Center and Graduate School of Advanced Science and Engineering, Hiroshima University . He holds a Ph.D. from The University of Tokyo, an M.S. in Computer Science from Georgia Institution of Technology, an M.E. in Electrical Engineering and Information Systems from The University of Tokyo, and a B.E. in Computer Science and Technology from University of Science and Technology Beijing. He was a research fellow at ETH Zurich and Japan Society for the Promotion of Science.
Meanwhile, Yepeng Ding is a system architect certified by the Chinese, Japanese, and Korean governments. He has directed dozens of development projects for startups and institutes since 2015.
